qas.question: What did American settlers call the Cherokee who attacked Fort Watuaga in 1776?
Who lead the Cherokee attack on Fort Watuaga in 1776?
What was the name of the Chickamauga leader's cousin who helped settlers escape his raids?
Who left Fort Watuaga, crossed the Appalachians, and attacked the British army in South Carolina in 1780?
Who lost the Battle of Kings Mountain in South Carolina?

context: During the American Revolutionary War, Fort Watauga at Sycamore Shoals (in present-day Elizabethton) was attacked (1776) by <a1_0>Dragging Canoe<a1_0/> and his warring faction of Cherokee who were aligned with the British Loyalists. These renegade Cherokee were referred to by settlers as <a0_0>the Chickamauga<a0_0/>. They opposed North Carolina's annexation of the Washington District and the concurrent settling of the Transylvania Colony further north and west. The lives of many settlers were spared from the initial warrior attacks through the warnings of Dragging Canoe's cousin, <a2_0>Nancy Ward<a2_0/>. The frontier fort on the banks of the Watauga River later served as a 1780 staging area for the <a3_0>Overmountain Men<a3_0/> in preparation to trek over the Appalachian Mountains, to engage, and to later defeat <a4_0>the British Army<a4_0/> at the Battle of Kings Mountain in South Carolina.
